page.title: 02PRINCIPAL FEATURES
page.content: {Crowan School}is no longer in Crowan. It is now in the village of Praze-an-Beeble. The school was built in 1890. About one and a half miles up the road are three{reservoirs. They each hold 30.5 million gallons of water. They are 520 feet above sea level. They service Crowan Village, Praze Village, Leedstown Village, Clowance and Drym hamlets. When water is short during the summer they only serve Crowan village. The system is 120 years old but in a few years time these reservoirs will be closed. The water will then be supplied from Stithians. Up the road from the reservoirs is the hamlet of Blackrock. There used to be a chapel but it is a dwelling house now.
